results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Walensky, Rochelle;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli and Benjamin Mueller
results.title: C.D.C. Chief Overrules Agency Panel and Recommends Pfizer-BioNTech Boosters for Workers at Risk
results.abstract: In a highly unusual decision, the C.D.C. director, Rochelle Walensky, reversed a move by agency advisers and endorsed additional doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for health care workers, teachers and other workers at risk.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Dr. Rochelle Walensky, the C.D.C. director, at a hearing in July.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Weather;Floods;Rain;Global Warming;Caribbean Area;Atlantic Ocean
results.byline: By The New York Times
results.title: Sam Becomes a Category 4 Hurricane
results.abstract: The fourth named storm to form in less than a week was forecast to strengthen Saturday night as it moved across the Atlantic Ocean.

media.caption: Hurricane Sam, which intensified to a Category 4 storm on Saturday, was producing winds of up to 140 miles per hour, according to the National Hurricane Center.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Law and Legislation;Ocasio-Cortez, Alexandria;Hoyer, Steny H;House of Representatives;Democratic Party;Israel
results.byline: By Luke Broadwater
results.title: Ocasio-Cortez apologizes for her ‘present’ vote on Iron Dome funding.
results.abstract: In a letter to constituents, the New York congresswoman suggested she had changed her “no” vote because she had been subjected to “hateful targeting” for opposing the aid.

media.caption: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Democrat of New York, drew condemnations on social media both from supporters of Israel and from progressives and pro-Palestinian activists after her “present” vote.

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2024;Elections, Governors;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);DeSantis, Ron;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Florida
results.byline: By Liz Mair
results.title: Ron DeSantis Was a Slam Dunk. Until He Wasn’t.
results.abstract: By following a G.O.P. base strategy on pandemic issues in a state hard hit by Covid, he may have left himself vulnerable.

results.adx_keywords: Hospitals;Nursing Homes;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Labor and Jobs;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Hochul, Kathleen C;Health Department (NYS);New York State;New York City
results.byline: By Sharon Otterman and Joseph Goldstein
results.title: New York Hospitals Face Possible Mass Firings as Workers Spurn Vaccines
results.abstract: With a Monday deadline looming, thousands of health care workers in the state are risking their jobs by not getting a coronavirus vaccine.

media.caption: A mobile vaccination unit visiting the Bronx River Houses in New York City on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Supermarkets and Grocery Stores;Mass Shootings;Deaths (Fatalities);Kroger Company;Collierville (Tenn)
results.byline: By Alyssa Lukpat and Giulia Heyward
results.title: The woman who was killed is remembered as ‘kind, generous, caring, selfless.’
results.abstract: Olivia King died in a hospital after the gunman shot her in the chest, one of her sons said.

media.caption: Embracing outside the scene of a shooting at a Kroger grocery store in Collierville, Tenn., on Thursday.
media.copyright: Joe Rondone/The Commercial Appeal, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Rumors and Misinformation;Conspiracy Theories;State Legislatures;Politics and Government;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Arizona
results.byline: By Jack Healy, Michael Wines and Nick Corasaniti
results.title: Republican Review of Arizona Vote Fails to Show Stolen Election
results.abstract: The criticized review showed much the same results as in November, with 99 more Biden votes and 261 fewer Trump ones.

media.caption: The chief executive of Cyber Ninjas, Doug Logan, helped deliver a report to the Arizona Senate on Friday about Maricopa County’s voting results from the 2020 election.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Privacy;Wills and Estates;Computer Security;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Spears, Britney;Spears, Jamie (1952- );Yemini, Edan;Vlasov, Alex;Greenhill, Robin;Black Box Security Inc;Tri Star Sports & Entertainment Group
results.byline: By Liz Day and Samantha Stark
results.title: The Surveillance Apparatus That Surrounded Britney Spears
results.abstract: An account by a former employee of the security team hired by Ms. Spears’s father created the most detailed portrait yet of the singer’s life under 13 years of conservatorship.

media.caption: Britney Spears in Las Vegas in 2018. A new documentary by The New York Times, “Controlling Britney Spears,” which examines the security operation surrounding the singer, was released on Friday.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Teachers and School Employees;Appeals Courts (US);de Blasio, Bill;Pfizer Inc;BioNTech SE;Education Department (NYC);New York City
results.byline: By Eliza Shapiro and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: A federal appeals court delays New York City’s vaccine mandate for teachers.
results.abstract: The mandate, which affects well over 150,000 people working in the nation’s largest school system, was set to go into effect on Monday at midnight.

media.caption: A teacher preparing her classroom for the reopening of school at Brooklyn Science & Engineering Academy on Sept. 9.
media.copyright: Gabby Jones for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;United States Politics and Government;Coronavirus Delta Variant;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Walensky, Rochelle;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Food and Drug Administration
results.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Michael D. Shear
results.title: As Biden hails Pfizer boosters, the C.D.C. director defends her move to include frontline workers.
results.abstract: Remarks by President Biden and the C.D.C. director, Dr. Rochelle Walensky, came after Dr. Walensky overruled a recommendation by her agency’s panel of scientific advisers against booster shots of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid vaccine for frontline workers.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Johnson & Johnson;Moderna Inc;Pfizer Inc;United States
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli and Benjamin Mueller
results.title: Boosters for Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccine recipients weren’t up for debate during a C.D.C. panel.
results.abstract: The panel was not asked to judge whether people who received the Moderna and Johnson & Johnson vaccines should receive Pfizer-BioNTech boosters.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Vials with Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna coronavirus disease (COVID-19) vaccine labels.

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Elderly;Drugstores;United States Politics and Government;Pfizer Inc;BioNTech SE;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;United States
results.byline: By Noah Weiland, Reed Abelson and Jan Hoffman
results.title: States Begin a Complex Booster Shot Rollout for Pfizer Recipients
results.abstract: Health officials were preparing on Friday to start giving booster shots to older and at-risk Americans, trying to make sense of new and broad eligibility guidelines.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: State and federal officials were unconcerned about the vaccine supply to cover those eligible for booster shots over the next few months.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Libel and Slander;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Decisions and Verdicts;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Censorship;News and News Media;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Computers and the Internet;Voller, Dylan;Facebook Inc;Australia
results.byline: By Oscar Schwartz
results.title: That Comment Someone Left on Facebook? It Can Get You Sued.
results.abstract: Australia’s top court has said media companies can be held liable for replies to their posts, prompting some to step back from the platform.

media.caption: Dylan Voller, who sued Australian media outlets over comments on their Facebook pages, in 2018.
media.copyright: Lukas Coch/Australian Associated Press, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Presidential Election of 2024;Constitution (US);Conservatism (US Politics);Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Vice Presidents and Vice Presidency (US);Pence, Mike;Eastman, John C;Republican Party
results.byline: By Jamelle Bouie
results.title: Trump Had a Mob. He Also Had a Plan.
results.abstract: The storming of the Capitol closed the door on one era of American politics and opened the door to another.

results.adx_keywords: Archaeology and Anthropology;Paleontology;Ice Age;Geology;Glaciers;Research;your-feed-science;Science (Journal);White Sands National Monument (NM);North America;New Mexico
results.byline: By Carl Zimmer
results.title: Ancient Footprints Push Back Date of Human Arrival in the Americas
results.abstract: Human footprints found in New Mexico are about 23,000 years old, a study reported, suggesting that people may have arrived long before the Ice Age’s glaciers melted.

media.caption: Fossilized human footprints that a White Sands National Park program manager first discovered.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Models (Professional);Plastic Surgery;Malpractice;Evangelista, Linda;Zeltiq Aesthetics Inc
results.byline: By Christine Hauser
results.title: Supermodel Linda Evangelista Says Cosmetic Procedure Left Her ‘Disfigured’
results.abstract: The ’90s-era supermodel said side effects from a fat-freezing procedure caused her to become depressed and turned her into a recluse after “not looking like myself any longer.”

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Masks;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Arizona
results.byline: By Roni Caryn Rabin
results.title: U.S. schools with mask requirements are seeing fewer outbreaks, the C.D.C. finds.
results.abstract: Arizona schools that did not require masks had 3.5 times as many outbreaks as those that mandated them.

media.caption: Students lining up in the cafeteria for lunch at Rising Hill Elementary in Kansas City, Mo., on Thursday.
media.copyright: Katie Currid for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Water;Content Type: Service;Fluorides;Teeth and Dentistry;Diet and Nutrition
results.byline: By Christina Caron
results.title: Is Carbonated Water Just as Healthy as Still Water?
results.abstract: Unsweetened carbonated water is a better choice than soda or fruit juice. But don’t overdo it, experts say.

media.copyright: Aileen Son for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Drug Abuse and Traffic;Deaths (Fatalities);Fentanyl;Williams, Michael Kenneth
results.byline: By Michael Gold and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: Michael K. Williams Died of a Drug Overdose, Authorities Say
results.abstract: The actor known for “The Wire,” who was found dead in his apartment earlier this month, died of intoxication by a mixture of heroin, cocaine and fentanyl. He had been open about his struggle with addiction.

media.caption: Michael K. Williams lived much of his life in East Flatbush, Brooklyn.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Game Shows;Contests and Prizes;Amodio, Matt
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs
results.title: Matt Amodio, the Latest ‘Jeopardy!’ Star, Breaks $1 Million
results.abstract: The Ph.D. student in computer science at Yale is only the third contestant to reach that level of winnings.

media.caption: Matt Amodio, a Yale graduate student, became the third contestant in “Jeopardy!” history to surpass $1 million in winnings.
media.copyright: Jeopardy! Productions Inc., via Associated Press
